channel.title: My cpu fan
channel.description:
I have a stock intel c2d cpu fan, and today it randomly stopped being noisy so I checked the rpm, and its only running at 1500 on max setting even though it should generally run at 3000 rpm
what should i do ??? http://[u][i][b]can any one help ne plzzz i need halp bad!!!!!!!!!! ???[/b][/i][/u]

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

WOW BORIZ AND YOU COULDNT TELL HIM DIS IRL BECAUSE???

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @boriz boriz
item.description:
@boriz wrote:

Invest in a quality fan. I got a V8 and I had about 55C idle temps and almost 70 at max usage…

I got an 80 dollar fan and now the temp NEVER goes above 35-38

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Well my Pentinum 4 3.06 is part of the “Prescott” family which means it gets very hot.
Ignore the second point but servicing your pc really helps.

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:9, topic:269781”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=356081.msg2724278#msg2724278 date=1238211935]

whats your cpu temps at? usually fans will kick speed up a notch once it goes over a certain temperature set in bios.

i’ve seen that temperature results in different speed, but its running at 47ºC right now and usually it would be going at 2500-3000 at this temp
[/quote]

I know its fixed now but every now and then hoover your cpu fans and tighten your heat sink. My P4 is now 10ºC cooler and the fan is neally 3 times slower.
My fan goes at 900-1000rpm while my cpu is the same temp as yours, If it normally goes 2500-3000 thats strange.[/quote]
every cpu has different temperature ranges so you cant compare it like that

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:3, topic:269781”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=356081.msg2724273#msg2724273 date=1238211799]
whats your cpu temps at? usually fans will kick speed up a notch once it goes over a certain temperature set in bios.
[/quote]
i’ve seen that temperature results in different speed, but its running at 47ºC right now and usually it would be going at 2500-3000 at this temp[/quote]

I know its fixed now but every now and then hoover your cpu fans and tighten your heat sink. My P4 is now 10ºC cooler and the fan is neally 3 times slower.
My fan goes at 900-1000rpm while my cpu is the same temp as yours, If it normally goes 2500-3000 thats strange.

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

no, i was playing gmod and the fan randomly declined in speed. its never gone this slow at max setting

edit: apparently it just fixed itself somehow but it would still be interesting to know why it did that

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

AMD has a thing called cool n quiet which underclocks the cpu when not doing anything and it keeps the fan speed down. There is an intel equivalent, do you have that?

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

xEnt:

maybe motherboard sensors broke? rpm, if the cpu temp is still fine, who cares about fan speed.

i doubt motherboard sensors broke cause i heard the fan slow down

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

I’m having the exact oppisite problem. Im running a P4 @3.06Ghz.
My CPU fan sometimes goes mad even if I am doing nothing. The idle temperature is 55ºC and then fan is running at 2600rpm.
I then ran a 3d fullscreen game and it was peaking 76ºC and the fan was going at 5000rpm.

Do you think getting a new thermal paste could solve the problem?

Read full topic

item.title: My cpu fan
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:

maybe motherboard sensors broke? rpm, if the cpu temp is still fine, who cares about fan speed.
